intro: Bidens mollis, commonly known as common tickseed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It features small, yellow daisy-like flowers with ray florets and a central disk, typically blooming from late spring to early fall. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flowers. Bidens mollis is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
